docs.title: Welcome to GIS I (CARTOGRAPHY)
docs.text: Hi there! Welcome to my GitHub repository, where I share teaching material. I'm excited to have you here!

docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
I am an Assistant Professor (AP) in Geography Department at The University of Central Arkansas.

I hold a Ph.D. from the Department of Geospatial Information Sciences at the University of Texas at Dallas (德州大学达拉斯分校).

docs.title: 10.1 Create a virtual environment in terminal¶
docs.text:
Right click the Anaconda prompt and Run as Administrator (This step will ensure that your package is installed in Anaconda/env folder)

The following command creates a conda environment named np with a Python 3.9 interpreter

conda create -n np python=3.9

docs.title: 10.2 Check conda is installed¶
docs.text: conda -V

docs.title: 10.3 List virtual environment¶
docs.text:
now if you list virgual envionment, you can see the virtual environment that you just create.

conda env list

For example, I have three virtual environment: base, arcpu_pro, np

docs.title: 10.4 Activate virtual environment¶
docs.text:
if you virtual environment named as 'np'

activate np

docs.title: 10.5 Install packages (e.g., numpy)¶
docs.text: conda install numpy

docs.title: 11. Delete a no longer needed virtual environment¶
docs.text:
For example, delete a virtual environment 'np'

conda remove -n np --all -y

docs.title: Anaconda¶
docs.text:
Anaconda Distribution is a popular platform that contains

  • conda - a package and environment manager for your command line interface
  • Over 300 automaticall-installed packages

docs.title: Installation¶
docs.text: To install Anaconda, download the installer from the Anaconda website. The installer will ask you to accept the license agreement, choose the installation directory.

docs.title: Usage¶
docs.text: After installing Anaconda, you can open the Anaconda Prompt to chekc your python version

docs.title: list virtual environment¶
docs.text: conda env list

docs.title: Create a virtual environment¶
docs.text:
Run the Anaconda as administor to install the virtual environment underanaconda

conda create --name name_of_your_virtual_environment

For example, create a virtual environment named 'spatial'

docs.title: List virtual environment¶
docs.text:
now if you list virgual envionment, you can see all the virutla environment under Anaconda

conda env list

docs.title: Activate virtual environment¶
docs.text:
Activate 'spatial' virtual environment

activate spatial

docs.title: Install packages (e.g., geopandas)¶
docs.text: conda install geopandas

docs.title: Set up ArcGIS Pro Account¶
docs.text:
You should get an invitation email to set up your ArcGIS account

The account is composed by your user name and clarku, e.g., yanawu_clarku.

docs.title: Log in ArcGIS Online¶
docs.text: • Follow the instruction on Geospatial Software Access to log in ArcGIS Online

docs.title: Install ArcGIS Pro¶
docs.text:
• At the top of the page, click your username and click My settings.
  • On the My settings page, click the Licenses side tab
  • Next to ArcGIS Pro, click Download ArcGIS Pro (Please note that ArcGIS Pro 3.x requires installation of Microsoft .NET Framework 6.x.x; see this Esri Technical Support document for more information and check the Microsoft website for .NET for available download options).

  • In the Download ArcGIS Pro window, review the language setting. To download a localized version of ArcGIS Pro, change the setting to the language you want.

  • Click Download.

An executable file (.exe) is downloaded to your computer.

  • Once the .exe file has fully installed and launched, click 'Your ArcGIS Organization URL'

  • Enter 'UCA-GIS' in the space ahead of “.maps.arcgis.com” and click Continue

  • Click University of Central Arkansas then enter your UCA credentials in the Single Sign-on window.

  • After you log in to ArcGIS Pro, your name and affiliation will appear in the top right corner.

docs.title: Arcpy
docs.text:
ArcPy is a Python site package that provides a set of tools for geographic data analysis and automation. While it's integrated into ArcGIS Pro, you can also use it outside of ArcGIS Pro by configuring the Python environment properly.

Locate the path of the default ArcGIS Python environment (typically: C:\Program Files\ArcGIS\Pro\bin\Python\envs\arcgispro-py3).

docs.title: Using ArcPy Outside of ArcGIS Pro¶
Step 1: Find the ArcGIS Python Environment¶
Step 2: Activate the Environment¶
docs.text:
Go to the anaconda virtual environment folder

Copy the arcgisori-py3 to the anaconda virtual environment folder

docs.text: It is a free source code editor developed by Microsoft. It supports a wide range of programming languages and frameworks, offering features like syntax highlighting, debuging, integrated Git Control, and extensions to enhance functionality.
